required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized Control Trial Comparing Analgesic Benefits of Ultrasound-guided Single vs Continuous Quadratus Lumborum Blocks (QLB)vs Intrathecal Morphine(ITM) for Post Cesarean Section Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Control Trial Comparing Analgesic Benefits of Ultrasound-guided Single vs Continuous Quadratus Lumborum Blocks vs Intrathecal Morphine for Post Cesarean Section Pain

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose of this study is to compare opioid consumption in morphine equivalents between the groups that received postoperative analgesia with intrathecal morphine versus US guided QL blocks versus US guided QL catheters

primary_outcome.measure: Total narcotic consumption in morphine equivalents (in milligrams)

secondary_outcome.measure: Total narcotic consumption in morphine equivalents (in milligrams)
pain as measured by the numerical pain score (NPS)
secondary_outcome.description: NPS is a 11-point scale with a higher number indicating more severe pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients showing side effects of pruritus
secondary_outcome.description: This numeric scale is a 11-point scale with a higher number indicating an extremely severe side effect

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients showing side effects of nausea
secondary_outcome.description: This numeric scale is a 11-point scale with a higher number indicating an extremely severe side effect

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients showing side effects of vomiting
secondary_outcome.description: This numeric scale is a 11-point scale with a higher number indicating an extremely severe side effect

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients showing side effects of sedation
secondary_outcome.description: This numeric scale is a 11-point scale with a higher number indicating an extremely severe side effect

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction will be measured on a Likert scale (5 points) ranging form extremely satisfied to not satisfied.

intervention.description: Spinal anesthesia with ITM + US guided QLB single shot sham block + QLB catheters with no continuous infusion
Spinal anesthesia without ITM + US guided QLB single shot with bupivacaine hydrochloride + QLB catheters with no continuous infusion
Spinal anesthesia without ITM + US guided QLB single shot with bupivacaine hydrochloride + QLB catheters continuously infusing 0.2% ropivacaine hydrochloride

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective C section via Pfannenstiel incision
- Living singleton pregnancy
- Gestation week at least 37 weeks
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) status 1, 2 and 3
- Primary and secondary C sections
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic pain
- Opioid tolerant patients
- Allergy to drugs used in the study.
- Cognitive dysfunction
- BMI > 40
- Coagulation disorder
- Local infection
- Inability to tolerate oral medication
- Previous intra-abdominal surgery
- Patients who will receive a combined spinal epidural for their C section
- Local anesthetics injected at any other fascial plane except the QLB plane (for e.g.- local wound infiltration by surgeon)
- Patients who received sedation or general anesthesia during their C section (midazolam, ketamine, fentanyl, propofol, hydromorphone)

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.keyword: nerve block for post delivery pain
